name: hamburger
content:
hamburger noun
(MEAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] (informal burger); (UK also beefburger) a round, flat piece of minced beef, fried and usually eaten between two halves of a bread roll
Envision/Corbis Documentary/GettyImages
[ U ] US (UK mince) beef that is cut into very small pieces, used to make hamburgers
Examples
Go anywhere in the world and you'll find some sort of hamburger restaurant.We had lunch at a hamburger joint and then went to see a movie.Although it's only a quick snack, a hamburger is very calorific.That hamburger stand is a nice little earner.a king-size hamburger

hamburger noun
(SYMBOL)
[ C ] (also hamburger button, hamburger icon, hamburger menu) a symbol consisting of three horizontal lines that you can touch or click on to see a menu, for example on a website or phone app: Every time I click on the hamburger the page scrolls to the top. The hamburger button is typically found in a top corner of a graphical user interface. If you’re designing a website, it’s usually recommended that you place hamburger icons in the top left corner of a page. Click on the hamburger menu (three bars) in the top right corner.

hamburger noun
(ON ROAD)
[ C ] UK a road junction (= where roads come together) consisting of a main road that goes through the middle of a roundabout (= a junction where traffic must go around a circular area in the middle): The simplest of these road layouts is the hamburger, which ploughs a two-way road through a central island. a hamburger junction/island/roundabout
Mr_Twister/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

Add to word list
Add to word list
very small pieces of beef (= meat from cattle), or this meat pressed into a round, flat shape, cooked, and usually eaten as a sandwich in a small, round roll (= piece of bread): [ U ] a pound of hamburger (meat) [ C ] I’ll take a hamburger and French fries, please.
